intro: Ononis spinosa f. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender, angular stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers with five petals, typically blooming in early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as coastal dunes or rocky slopes. Its compact growth form and drought tolerance make it well adapted to harsh environments.
